job_title: Anonymous Employee in Helena, MT
pros: Decent pay & benefits. They try to keep current with the tools necessary to complete tasks.
cons: Not friendly unless you're part of the "good old boys club." They promote people into management who are not ready & don't know how to lead. HUGE disconnect between administration & workers. Difficult to get anything done without Director approval, even the simplest of requests. My Director was new, inexperienced, and totally in over her head! I was guaranteed 3 months of orientation (I was managing a program) when I moved here from Missoula & got two weeks training then I was completely on my own. I only saw my Director twice in the first 2 months despite several attempts to meet with her. Negative environment overall. I absolutely WOULD NOT recommend this organization. I was salaried, working between 50-60 hours/week with no acknowledgement or recognition.

review_title: Outdated policies and refusal to change.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Helena, MT
pros: St Peter's is pretty much the only hospital in the area so if you don't like it here, they don't care because you don't have anywhere else to go.
cons:
The ABOUT section for St Peter's Health here on Glassdoor is a few years outdated. They are no longer Joint certified. They kept falling short of the Joint certification requirements so instead of fixing things they just switch to a lesser certifying body. The logo was changed years ago. and the CEO is now Wade Johnson, not Mark Taylor.
Many medical and patient policies are 20-30 years outdated but management is incompetent and isn't willing to change. They don't need to fix anything because there is nowhere else for anyone to go in town. Patients will keep showing up no matter how bad the hospital is.
Do you have an idea of something that needs fixed? Are you seeing policies that are actively hurting your patients? Do you have documentation and studies to show that some things need changed? Bring it to your manager and they will ignore you or say they will work on it and sweep in under the rug.
Do you have a problem with your manager? That's too bad, there is nowhere to find out who his superior is to try to discuss the problems. 
After working here for a few years, did you come across his boss totally randomly in the elevator? Don't talk to them about your problems with your manager because your manage will come right to you and threaten to fire you for going over his head.

review_title: I loved helping people...too bad Management didnt feel the same
job_title: TCA Tech in Albany, NY
pros: Helping people really felt good.
cons:
I worked as a Tech in the ICU. An under paid over worked job. Some of the RN Nurses were truly great and cared. But many others did not. They would not answer call lights even when sitting right in front of the room.

Management was terrible. They cut the number of Techs in half while added extra duties, but added more and more "Supervisors", etc who did nothing.

The Exec, MGT was the worst. Hide in the offices all day long, had no idea what was going on and looked dirty and drugged half the time. They ordered 2 Keurig machines and a Cappuccino machine, billed to the hospital ( I saw the bill), but wouldnt order a new Glucometer because it was too expensive. They cared more about expensive coffee drinks than having proper equipment and staff!! 

This was the ICU!! Where the sickest patients go!! If this is how the ICU functions can you imagine what the less urgent departments are like?!  If I am ever very sick I will not go to St. Peters Hospitals. There are no more Nurses of my Mothers generation left.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Albany, NY
pros: Hard working dedicated staff members.
cons:
Health insurance covering less and less.  Minimum of 10% coinsurance
Expected to complete 2 people’s jobs with no increase in pay.
Director does not take accountability for actions and allows others to believe it was a team members failure when it was hers 
Director sets standards for staff that she does not follow herself.  Poor example of the mission.
